definition: to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up
to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: People put in plastic bags everything they buy.
sentences.chinese: 人们把在胶袋的一切，他们采办。

sentences.english: Gathering timbers for the imperial palace was an important social task in the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 皇木采办是明代社会的重要内容。

sentences.english: In the future, shopping can be done by videophone.
sentences.chinese: 在将来，采办东西能在可视电话中进行。

sentences.english: He was responsible for procuring supplies for the army.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责是为部队采办军需品。

sentences.english: Not all of the wood procurement for the current use, many stores use.
sentences.chinese: 所采办的木料并非都为现用，很多存储备用。

sentences.english: I think for such safety criticing products, the Chinese should buy them from outside.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这样安静关键产品，中国人该当从国外采办。

sentences.english: The Defence Ministry has given special permission for fast-track acquisitions for the Navy.
sentences.chinese: 现在国防部已经给与了印度海军快速采办的特许权。

sentences.english: The program will support the transition to a full-fledged Army acquisition program.
sentences.chinese: 该计划将支撑向成熟陆军采办计划的过渡。

sentences.english: You need to fill out the purchase requisition form and have it signed by your supervisor.
sentences.chinese: 你必需填写采办需求单，并让你的打点者签字。

definition: to purchase/to buy/to do one's shopping/purchasing agent/buyer
silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
produced locally/local product (with distinctive native features)
to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
to provide (items for an event)/to cater/to make preparations
to purchase goods (for a company etc)
